meanings.definition: To become stuck or blocked due to an accumulation of logs.
meanings.sent1: The river logjammed after heavy rain caused many trees to fall in.
meanings.sent2: The road was logjammed with fallen trees after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The beavers logjammed the stream with their impressive dam-building skills.
meanings.sent4: The traffic logjammed as everyone tried to merge into one lane.
meanings.sent5: The logjammed water flow created a beautiful natural barrier in the forest.

meanings.definition: To cause a situation to become stuck or blocked due to an accumulation of logs.
meanings.sent1: The workers accidentally logjammed the river by cutting down too many trees.
meanings.sent2: The lumber company logjammed the creek by leaving logs in the water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous beavers logjammed the waterway as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The fallen trees logjammed the path, making it impossible to pass.
meanings.sent5: The logjammed area became a playground for adventurous squirrels.
